title: Bug 7734 - System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down the system with unsaved changes in a file, users should be prompted with a warning message giving them a chance to save their work.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Observe that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down or reboot the computer.
5. Verify that a warning or question message box is shown, giving the user a chance to save their unsaved changes, before shutting down/rebooting the computer.
